CLOSURE_REASON: Case Closed. Closed date : 2015-10-27 10:10:49.25 Case Resolved Dear Constituent     Eversource  Gas is installing a new gas main.  The city encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will eliminate future emergency repairs.      Eversource Gas has to install the gas main first.  Once the main has been installed  then all service connections can be made.      If the city were to make Eversource Gas pave to grade each day's trench work   it would cause multiple seams along the trench.    More importantly  every service connection needs to be cut into the trench.  If we were to pave the trench every day   this would result in 2 by 2 patches inside the trench area  resulting in a very poor final product.      In order to have the best final paving  the city allows the utility company to leave the trench down low until all service connections are made and then pave the trench all at once  resulting in a smooth  level final trench repair.      Service laterals are topped within 24 hours of excavation.       What the constituent is observing is the trench left down low in preparation for one continuous final paving operation.
